alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:57PM EST until December 20 at 12:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Quinebaug River near Jewett City affecting New London County. For the Quinebaug...including Jewett City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Quinebaug River near Jewett City. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Norman Road and banjo Sullivan Road are closed with water covering the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.5 ft. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EST Tuesday was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 15 ft by Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 10/16/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Quinebaug River Jewett City 17.5 17.8 Tue 6 pm EST 15.0 12.5 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
